The total effect in poor countries is significant at the 0.01 level, indicating a negative impact of temperature change on TFP growth rate in these countries. Using the end of the time-series as a representative year.
Average negative shocks to TFP growth rate were 0.018%/year (SE 0.005%) larger than positive shocks. The end year is 2006

The impact of temperature shocks on labour productivity growth is negative and significant only in poor countries. Similar in significance and magnitude to TFP regressions. The end year is 2006, and the value is effectively zero since no specific number is provided, only the nature of the effect.
